excerpt: "The rise of artificial intelligence (AI) is making an impact in genomics, biotech, pharmaceuticals, and life sciences. In a study published on Monday in Nature Machine Intelligence, a team of University of California San Diego (UCSD) researchers led by Melissa Gymrek created an AI machine learning framework to enable genomics insights on the binding of transcription factors (TF)â€”a framework that may one day help speed up precision medicine and the development of novel treatments for diseases."
